}} 'Barbara Ann Mikulski' (born July 20, 1936) is the senior United States
Senator from Maryland and a member of the Democratic Party, serving since 1987.
Mikulski, a former United States Representative from 1977 to 1987, is the longest-
serving woman in the history of the U.S. Congress.

Raised in the Highlandtown neighborhood of East Baltimore, Mikulski attended
Mount Saint Agnes College and the University of Maryland School of Social Work.
Originally a social worker and community organizer, she was elected to the
Baltimore City Council in 1971 after delivering a highly publicized address on
the "ethnic movement" in America. She was elected to the U.S. House of
Representatives in 1976, and in 1986 she became the first woman elected to the
U.S. Senate from Maryland.

Mikulski has chaired the Senate Appropriations Committee since the death of
Senator Daniel Inouye in December 2012. She also serves on the
Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee and the Select Committee on
Intelligence.
